00005 #include "MyJuceApp_Headers.h"
00006 #include "MainAppWindow.h" 
00007 
00008 //============================================================================== 
00009 class AppClass : public JUCEApplication 
00010         { 
00011                 /* Important! NEVER embed objects directly inside your JUCEApplication class! Use 
00012                  ONLY pointers to objects, which you should create during the initialise() method 
00013                  (NOT in the constructor!) and delete in the shutdown() method (NOT in the 
00014                  destructor!) 
00015                  
00016                  This is because the application object gets created before Juce has been properly 
00017                  initialised, so any embedded objects would also get constructed too soon. 
00018                  */ 
00019                 MainAppWindow* theMainWindow;
00020                 
00021                 ApplicationCommandManager* m_commandManager;
00022                 
00023         public: 
00024                 //============================================================================== 
00025                 AppClass() 
00026         : theMainWindow (0),
00027                   m_commandManager(0)
00028                 { 
00029                         // This is where the application itself is created. It's a bit like a shell, which 
00030                         // all your real app stuff gets born into. At this point (where the app pops into 
00031                         // being), Juce doesn't really 'exist' yet, so we can't do anything with it here. 
00032                         // Once this application shell has been established, Juce will be awake so we can 
00033                         // create instances of its classes willy-nilly. 
00034                         
00035                         // [Jules says...] 
00036                         // NEVER do anything in here that could involve any Juce function being called 
00037                         // - leave all your startup tasks until the initialise() method. 
00038                 } 
00039                 
00040                 ~AppClass() 
00041                 { 
00042                         // This is where the application body is destroyed, and making any Juce calls in 
00043                         // here could be very dangerous. 
00044                         
00045                         // Just as Juce wasn't awake when the shell was created, by this stage it's been 
00046                         // tidied away and put to sleep. This is the bit that happens AFTER your program 
00047                         // code has ended (and hopefully put all its toys away). 
00048                         
00049                         // [Jules says...] 
00050                         // Your shutdown() method should already have done all the things necessary to 
00051                         // clean up this app object, so you should never need to put anything in 
00052                         // the destructor. 
00053                 } 
00054                 
00055                 //============================================================================== 
00056                 void initialise (const String& commandLine) 
00057                 { 
00058                         // This is called automatically when the application is ready to launch. 
00059                         // So far, it just exists in memory as an empty pocket of potential waiting 
00060                         // to burst into life as a program. Nothing yet exists to act or be displayed. 
00061                         
00062                         // All we want to do here is create the main window. This instantiates an object 
00063                         // of 'MainAppWindow' - which we have defined in MainAppWindow(.h/.cpp). The app's 
00064                         // behaviour comes from that, so all we need is to bring it to life... 
00065 
00066                         m_commandManager = new ApplicationCommandManager();
00067                         theMainWindow = new MainAppWindow(m_commandManager);
00068                         m_commandManager->registerAllCommandsForTarget(JUCEApplication::getInstance());
00069                         theMainWindow->centreWithSize (800, 400);   // [*] (see below for a tip on this) 
00070                         theMainWindow->setVisible (true); 
00071                         
00072                 } 
00073                 
00074                 void shutdown() 
00075                 { 
00076                         // This gets called when the application is ready to shut down. 
00077                         // Anything that we created in the initialise() function should be destroyed, 
00078                         // so that nothing is left hanging around when the app shell ceases to exist. 
00079                         
00080                         // All we need to do here is delete the MainAppWindow we created... 
00081                         deleteAndZero (theMainWindow);
00082                         deleteAndZero(m_commandManager);
00083                 } 
00084                 
00085                 //============================================================================== 
00086                 const String getApplicationName() 
00087                 { 
00088                         // The name for the application 
00089                         return T("Juce tutorial application"); 
00090                 } 
00091                 
00092                 const String getApplicationVersion() 
00093                 { 
00094                         // Here we can give a 'version' indicator, to distinguish one build from 
00095                         // another. If you update your program, it's a good idea to also update 
00096                         // the string returned here. 
00097                         return T("0.0"); 
00098                 } 
00099                 
00100                 bool moreThanOneInstanceAllowed() 
00101                 { 
00102                         // We can prevent multiple instances of the application here by returning false. 
00103                         return true; 
00104                 } 
00105                 
00106                 void anotherInstanceStarted (const String& commandLine) 
00107                 { 
00108                         // This will get called if the user launches another copy of the application. 
00109                 } 
00110         }; 
00111

00114 // This macro creates the application's main() function.. 
00115 START_JUCE_APPLICATION(AppClass)
